thread.title: Mike Dean to referee Burnley vs Leicester in return to Premier League action next week
thread.title_full: Mike Dean to referee Burnley vs Leicester in return to Premier League action next week

author: James Whaling
title: Mike Dean to referee Burnley vs Leicester in return to Premier League action next week
text:
Sport Mike Dean to referee Burnley vs Leicester in return to Premier League action next week Dean will be the man in the middle at Turf Moor next Tuesday in his first match in the top flight since being demoted to the Championship last week Share Dean will return to Premier League action next week (Photo: Man Utd   
Mike Dean will return to Premier League action next week as he takes charge of the fixture between Burnley and Leicester. 
Dean will be the man in the middle at Turf Moor next Tuesday in his first match in the top flight since being demoted to the Championship last week. 
The 48-year-old refereed the Yorkshire derby between Barnsley and Leeds at Oakwell, and his decision-making was once more thrust into the spotlight. 
Dean awarded a penalty to the Whites for handball against Tykes defender Marc Roberts, but replays showed the incident clearly took place outside the 18-yard box. Dean hit the headlines at West Ham vs Manchester United (Photo: Getty Images Europe) He will take charge of Burnley vs Leicester next Tuesday (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
The ref endured a testing Christmas period, including his controversial sending off of West Ham platyer Sofiane Feghouli against Manchester United, which was later rescinded. 
Zlatan Ibrahimovic also scored a clearly offside goal during that clash. 
Dean was also criticised for failing to send off Ross Barkley for a late tackle on Jordan Henderson during the Mereseyside derby on December 19. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
